str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: (a) I am awake (in the night), watch, (b) I am watchful, on the alert, vigilant. From egeiro; to keep awake, i.e. Watch.
And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To sleep, be sleeping. From kata and heudo; to lie down to rest, i.e. to fall asleep.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
A primary particle; properly, at the 'same' time, but freely used as a preposition or adverb denoting close association.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
